intro: Galium persicum, commonly known as Persian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium persicum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
